| A hound of Tindalos:* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* may [turn against you](/wiki/Treachery "Treachery") when tame. |                                                                                                                                                                                       |

A **hound of Tindalos**, d, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). Hounds of Tindalos are [insight](/wiki/Insight "Insight") monsters that are [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing"), [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious") and [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal").

A hound of Tindalos has a vampiric polearm-range reach attack, a tentacle attack, and the ability to cast mage [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spells "Monster spells") - they will exclusively use [open wounds](/wiki/Open_wounds "Open wounds") when casting.

## Generation

Hounds of Tindalos are not normally randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

If a character has high insight, hounds of Tindalos will periodically manifest in clouds of blue mist, appearing in packs from the corners of rooms.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Hound_of_Tindalos\&action=edit)*
html:
Hound of Tindalos

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
d hound of Tindalos (No tile)
Difficulty 18
Attacks Reach 2d6 vampiric, Tentacle 4d4 physical, Cast 0d6 mage spell
d hound of Tindalos (No tile)
Difficulty 18
Attacks

Reach 2d6 vampiric, Tentacle 4d4 physical, Cast 0d6 mage spell

Base level 14
Base experience 506
Speed 12
Base AC 2
Base MR 0
Alignment 7 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 900
Nutritional value 300
Size medium
Resistances poison

A hound of Tindalos:

  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • may turn against you when tame.

A hound of Tindalos, d, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. Hounds of Tindalos are insight monsters that are unbreathing, amphibious and carnivorous animals.

A hound of Tindalos has a vampiric polearm-range reach attack, a tentacle attack, and the ability to cast mage monster spells - they will exclusively use open wounds when casting.

Generation

Hounds of Tindalos are not normally randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

If a character has high insight, hounds of Tindalos will periodically manifest in clouds of blue mist, appearing in packs from the corners of rooms.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''hound of Tindalos''', {{blue|d}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. Hounds of Tindalos are [[insight]] monsters that are [[unbreathing]], [[amphibious]] and [[carnivorous]] [[animal]]s.

A hound of Tindalos has a vampiric polearm-range reach attack, a tentacle attack, and the ability to cast mage [[monster spells]] - they will exclusively use [[open wounds]] when casting.

==Generation==
Hounds of Tindalos are not normally randomly generated, and are always created hostile.

If a character has high insight, hounds of Tindalos will periodically manifest in clouds of blue mist, appearing in packs from the corners of rooms.
